column4: how can I get nautilus to open folders in thunar on the desktop?
nautilus and thunar are both filemanagers you arent making any sense.
gnome uses nautilus as the desktop drawer
so nautilus draws the desktop, so when I double click folders they open in nautilus rather than thunar
yes filemanager you mean, you want it to use thunar instead?
http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/nonautilusplease its took my 5 seconds on google to find this please do your research before asking questions here
you are exceptionally rude, I already used that script
and it doesn't replace nautilus to draw the background/desktop
thunar doesnt do backgrounds.
im not sure what you want here
I want nautilus to open folders in thunar. Since nautilus is running to control my desktop, it keeps launching folders to itself. I want to tell it to open with thunar
I get it, so you dont want to replace nautilus
well, not completely I suppose - I tried xfdesktop4 but it was... not to my liking
why dont you set your background with some other app and just remove nautilus in favor of thunar
that would be okay. I just don't know of another/better background manager, like I said I tried xfdesktop4, but that was not good
feh
feh can be used to set background images.
its in the repos
I'm reading the --help right now, thanks
thanks for the feh suggestion
no problem
are there any errors when you run the script?
none, and there are forum topics on this as well, with the same scripts mentioned, and the same lack of change in regards to nautilus/desktop
well enjoy feh for the time being im out to lunch
